instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2: What is SMC_PM_G2? This is a typo of SMC_PM_G2_EN When you see SMC_PM_G2, assume they meant to type SMC_PM_G2_EN.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is now dead, I get no light on the charger. The board does not increase in temp. I got 20v coming in from my 85w adapter and g3h is active at 3.42v,,. I am fairly new to this so any info given in dummy format would be much appreciated. someone mentioned the USB power rail but I cant seem to pin point. 

Thank you so much in advance.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Now i am getting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> .721v and dropping.. meaning it drops numbers by the second. on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> i got 0.001v

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Post diode mode (red probe at ground) at L7030.
Also for L7220/60 and the other coils.
Check for short (or low value) to ground on USB power and data lines.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: can you guide me to the usb power lines???

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Diode mode: L7030 0.0424v 
L7220 gives me a beep at 0.018v
L7060 0.129v

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: I am also not getting anything on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
"L7030 0.0424v"
Are you sure it is not close to 0.400-0.450 instead???

"L7220 gives me a beep at 0.018v"
That is too low.
I hope you've disconnected power when measured diode mode.
Also allow 10-15s after power is removed.

"usb power lines???"
Post diode mode at pins 2/6 of <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Correct me if I am wrong, this means there is a short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.040v 

Doesn?t S5 need to work in order for s4 to turn on?

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> looks bad too.
Few things connected there.
Check again disconnecting trackpad.
Also check for short on <SIGNAL>5V_SUS</SIGNAL>.
When you get <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>, go for <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

Don't forget, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is first required.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is: 12v isn?t this supposed to be 12.5? 
i have the board taken out with nothing connected to it.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Do you really get 12.0V?
What about <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Yes , I checked at <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR> pin 4... it?s 12v sometimes 12.1
<SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is now 0.116v 
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2</SIGNAL> is at .455v

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is good.
I hope you still get 3V42 at least.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Smc reset is 2.456v 

keep in mind that my light indicator does not turn on as well

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Yes 3v42 is good

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Post all <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> voltages.
Remove F7040/41 and check L7030 voltage.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>
pin 1: 3.431v
pin 2: 0.000v
pin 3: 3.431v
pin 4: 2.776v
pin 5: 2.446v
pin 6: 2.421v
pin 7: 3.432v
pin 8: 3.344v

L7030: diode mode 0.420v 
voltage mode plugged in 12.12v

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
You have a problem with <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>; it should be steady 3.3V.
Remove <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> and check it again.
If still bad, remove (clean at least) J6100.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5028</RESISTOR> is OK; remove it and test <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_R_L</SIGNAL>,
Ig good, then change SMC.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: I don?t have a J6000 or <RESISTOR>R5028</RESISTOR>

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
J5100, sorry.
Are you sure only <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> connected to pin 5 of <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>?
Check continuity from there to <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR>.
<RESISTOR>R5028</RESISTOR> is 0 ohm resistor, so may not be placed, if trace is OK.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: There is continuity between <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> and the few components connected to it.. I am still getting 2.6v on smc reset L... where is that power coming from.. I have a feeling something else is preventing it

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: I removed <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> and I get 1.4v on smc reset

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Replaced <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and now I have 3.4 on smc reset on pin 5 and <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> but when I probe <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> I still only get 1.6

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is generated through <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR>, from 3V42.
And <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> controls the delay time required by reset function.

"when I probe <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> I still only get 1.6"
Do you mean <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> drops to 1.6V when solder <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR>?
Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> then.
Which pin of <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> has 1.6V?

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Ok so now I get 3.27 without smc on.. with smc on I get 2.8

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Try other SMC then...

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Replaced SMC and I now have a green light and computer boots.. thank you for all your help and please mark as solved

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message: Never mind spoke too soon... computer keeps restarting.. I get log in screen sometimes but it goes half way and gets stuck

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Instant Death after powered USB plugged in. PLEASE HELP!
threads.message:
Try SMC bypass mode.
Reball the SMC, be sure to have good solders.
